@Module.Name: Select
@Module.Description: This module is a selection model, selecting the 5 possible component without relativity ranking to be acted on catering to user's intent
@Module.Note: This individual module only select 5 highly related components,without ranking them,and without analyzing the correctness of the components aligning with user's content

Output.<div id=11 class='' > Manage notificatio: The component with id=11 represents 'Manage Notifications' within the settings page. As the user's intent is to turn on notifications, this component is highly likely to pertain to the intended action.
Output.<div id=12 class='' > Default notificati: The component with id=12, labeled as 'Default notification action', may correspond to the overall notification settings. It, therefore, is a potential candidate for turning on notifications.
Output.<div id=3 class='android:id/checkbox' >: The component with id=3 is styled as a checkbox and, while we lack description, checkboxes often represent toggle actions like turning off/on notifications.
Output.<div id=7 class='android:id/checkbox' >: The component with id=7 also presents a checkbox. Again, checkboxes are frequently used to toggle settings on and off and in this context, it could be related to notification settings.
Output.<div id=10 class='android:id/checkbox' >: The fifth selection, component with id=10 is another checkbox element. As mentioned earlier, checkboxes are typically used for toggle actions like activating or deactivating certain features. Hence, it could be related to notification settings and should be further investigated.

@Module.Name: Plan
@Module.Description: This module is a plan module, planning the next action based on the selected components, whether click or edit

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
